summary: This is an email chain from July 25, 2019, discussing a report from the Bureau of Prisons about Jeffrey Epstein being found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck. The email corrects a typo regarding a threat from his cellmate and notes Epstein was placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck, placed on suicide watch, and reportedly threatened by his cellmate.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.context: Advised the reporting party about Epstein's condition and the threat from his cellmate.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal
persons.context: Sent the initial email reporting the incident from the Bureau of Prisons.

connections.description: The Associate Warden at MCC New York reported on Epstein's condition and the threat from his cellmate.
The Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal relayed information about Epstein's incident from the Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Epstein found with noose in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck, escorted to medical, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Email correction about cellmate threat
events.description: An email corrected a typo in the initial report, clarifying that Epstein's cellmate reportedly threatened to kill him, not 'threated'.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on July 24, 2019, at 0127 hours with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch and later downgraded to suicide observation.
Epstein's cellmate reportedly threatened to kill him, according to the Associate Warden.
The incident was under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons at the time of the email.
